result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott R. Kohn

records.addlTxt: No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and alcohol and no contact with minors other than incidental contact.

Court calls 22CF57 & 22CM20 @01:54 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Scott R. Kohn in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Scott R. Kohn in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott R. Kohn appeared by video means with Attorney.  Def., DA and reporter by Zoom.  Atty. Laufenberg in person.  Def. has copy of complaint, pleads not guilty on misd.  Request PH on felony and waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  State would like to address bond.  Bond modified as requested.  Bond to cover 22-CM-20 also.  Same conditions.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 010634,
Payable Number: 65625,
Receipt Number: 22R 001262,
Amount: $20.00

01:06 PM Defendant Scott R. Kohn in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties via Zoom.  Court calls both cases 22CF57 and 22CM20.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Defendant has chosen to have council through a Public Defender.  Attorney Gebert makes a recommendation and asks for a $3,000 cash bail bond with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and alcohol, and no contact with minors.  Defendant makes response to DA.  The court rules a $5,000 cash bond with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and alcohol, and no contact with minors other than incidental contact.  Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled on April 11th, 2022 at 1:30 PM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant Scott R. Kohn in court with attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert.  Defendant Scott R. Kohn in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
